name: SDLC Process
description: The process used by the organisation to deliver software, including the design, development, testing and packaging of the overall solution to deliver software in a repeatable, methodical way to ensure completion within time and cost estimates.

components.name: Process Definition
components.definition: how the SDLC process is defined, audited and improved

criteria.name: Some processes are defined and followed by individuals (possibly using standards such as Scrum, SAFe, PRINCE2, PMBOK, etc.)
criteria.definition: Some processes are defined and followed by individuals (possibly using standards such as Scrum, SAFe, PRINCE2, PMBOK, etc.)

criteria.name: Processes are defined within individual teams with minimal process discipline in place.
criteria.definition: Processes are defined within individual teams with minimal process discipline in place.

criteria.name: Processes are defined and followed group-wide in a repeatable manner.
criteria.definition: Processes are defined and followed group-wide in a repeatable manner.

criteria.name: Regular process audits are performed.
Regular process audits are performed and quantifiable process improvement goals are set.
criteria.definition: Regular process audits are performed and quantifiable process improvement goals are set.

criteria.name: No sampling of process metrics
No standards to artifacts
Ad-hoc communications
Ad-hoc process
Clear definition of process
Managed communications
Standards to artifacts
KPIs, Continuous improvement
Some roles are defined. Engagement from business or IT depends on the heroic efforts of individuals.
criteria.definition: Some roles are defined. Engagement from business or IT depends on the heroic efforts of individuals.

criteria.name: Roles are defined within individual teams. Key members of the team are trained in understanding the roles.
criteria.definition: Roles are defined within individual teams. Key members of the team are trained in understanding the roles.

criteria.name: Roles are defined and followed group-wide in a consistent manner (e.g. Product Owner, Scrum Master, etc. if using Scrum).
criteria.definition: Roles are defined and followed group-wide in a consistent manner (e.g. Product Owner, Scrum Master, etc. if using Scrum).

components.name: Tools
components.definition: what tools are used that help automate the SDLC

criteria.name: Some tools are used by individuals (e.g. simple spreadsheets, Jira, Microsoft Planner, GitHub Project, etc.), but may not be widely adopted by teams.
criteria.definition: Some tools are used by individuals (e.g. simple spreadsheets, Jira, Microsoft Planner, GitHub Project, etc.), but may not be widely adopted by teams.

criteria.name: Common tools are adopted and used consistently within individual teams in a repeatable manner.
criteria.definition: Common tools are adopted and used consistently within individual teams in a repeatable manner.

criteria.name: Common tools are adopted and used consistently group-wide.  Tools facilitate automation of the SDLC.
criteria.definition: Common tools are adopted and used consistently group-wide.  Tools facilitate automation of the SDLC.

components.name: Data
components.definition: how data is collected about the effectiveness of the development process

criteria.name: Some data is collected (such as velocity, lead time for change, etc.) but collection may be ad-hoc and driven by individuals' desire to improve the process.
criteria.definition: Some data is collected (such as velocity, lead time for change, etc.) but collection may be ad-hoc and driven by individuals' desire to improve the process.

criteria.name: Data is collected within individual teams with some consistency.
criteria.definition: Data is collected within individual teams with some consistency.

criteria.name: Standards for SDLC data collections exist group-wide and are followed in a repeatable and comparable manner.
criteria.definition: Standards for SDLC data collections exist group-wide and are followed in a repeatable and comparable manner.

criteria.name: Metrics are surfaced at group level.
criteria.definition: Metrics are surfaced at group level.

criteria.name: KPIs and improvement goals are set.
criteria.definition: KPIs and improvement goals are set.

questions.definition:
What are the primary type of assets developed on the team?
a.	That is - code and software development assets that are authored on your team. This includes management, scripting and deployment infrastructure.
b.	Please call out any major systems & Components (e.g. SSB, SS)

Tooling (in all cases - please provide links or entry points)
a.	How do you manage your team's work-in-progress and track progress?
b.	Source control?
c.	Build tools and a CI/CD pipeline?
d.	Deployment?
e.	Knowledge management? (e.g. Confluence)
Do you have onboarding and developer guides? (If so - please provide links)

What are the different roles defined in the team (project manager, product owner, developer, Ops, etc.)?
a.	Do you have a project charter?
b.	If there are multiple companies involved, what is the split of responsibilities?
Are they any coding standards, best practices or processes adhered to by the team?
Do you perform any automated testing?

How representative is your test environment of production, with respect to:
a.	Capacity
b.	Interfacing systems
c.	Alerting
What are the metrics and statistics gathered helping the SDLC processes? (e.g. defect rates, velocity, test coverage, code quality)
Are there any KPIs tracked regularly around process improvement?

Is your adherence to a standard SDLC regularly audited?
a.	Are there any historic audit reports available for review?
